intro: Tricholobus verruculosus, commonly known as the warty tricholobus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, warty stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
